net.dempsy.threading

Interface ThreadingModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultThreadingModel

    public interface ThreadingModel
extends AutoCloseable

    The Threading model for Dempsy needs to work in close concert with the Transport. The implementation of the DempsyExecutor should be chosen along with the Transport. If, for example, the transport can handle acknowledged delivery of messages then the Executor should be able to apply 'back pressure' by blocking in the submitLimted.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ThreadingModel.Rejectable<V>
      This is an interface that represents a Callable that can be rejected if the ThreadingModel deems it's to be rejected.

      How many pending limited tasks are there
      int getNumThreads()

      start a thread to be used with the threading model.

      Start up the executor

      Submit a Callable that is guaranteed to execute.
      <V> Future<V> submitLimited(ThreadingModel.Rejectable<V> r, boolean count)
      This method queues Callables that can expire or have some maximum number allowed.

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        <V> Future<V> submit(Callable<V> r)
        Submit a Callable that is guaranteed to execute. Unlike submitLimted this method acts like the Callable was added to an unbounded queue and so should eventually execute.

      • submitLimited

        <V> Future<V> submitLimited(ThreadingModel.Rejectable<V> r,
                            boolean count)
        This method queues Callables that can expire or have some maximum number allowed. Normal message processing falls into this category since 'shedding' is the standard behavior. If counting is true then the ThreadingModel should queue it without counting it against the maximum capacity.

      • schedule

        <V> Future<V> schedule(Callable<V> r,
                       long delay,
                       TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Schedule a task to be executed at some time in the future.

      • runDaemon

        default void runDaemon(Runnable daemon,
                       String name)
        start a daemon process using this ThreadingModel. This defaults to using the newThread call with the runnable and name and starting it. Note, this does NOT set the thread to a daemon thread.

      • newThread

        default Thread newThread(Runnable runnable,
                         String name)
        start a thread to be used with the threading model. Defaults to simply creating a thread using with the runnable and name. Note, this does NOT set the thread to a daemon thread.

      • getNumberLimitedPending

        int getNumberLimitedPending()
        How many pending limited tasks are there

      • start

        ThreadingModel start()
        Start up the executor

      • close

        void close()
        Perform a clean shutdown of the executor
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • getNumThreads

        int getNumThreads()
        This return value may not be valid prior to start().
